content: योगिन् {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [युज्-घिनुण्, योग-इनि वा] {@--1@} Connected or endowed with. {@--2@} Possessed of magical powers. {@--3@} Endowed or provided with, possessing. {@--4@} Practising {%Yoga%}. {%--<ab>m.</ab>%} {@--1@} A contemplative saint, a devotee, an ascetic; आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योर्जुन . सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः <ls>Bg. 6. 32</ls>; see the sixth adhyāya {%inter alia%}; सेवाधर्मः परमगहनो योगिनामप्यगम्यः <ls>Pt. 1. 285</ls>; बभूव योगी किल कार्तवीर्यः <ls>R. 6. 38.</ls> {@--2@} A magician, sorcerer. {@--3@} A follower of the {%Yoga%} system of philosophy. {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of Yājñavalkya. {@--5@} Of Arjuna. {@--6@} Of Viṣṇu. {@--7@} Of Śiva. {@--8@} <ab>N.</ab> of a mixed caste. --नी {@--1@} A female magician, witch, sorceress, fairy. {@--2@} A female devotee. {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of a class of female attendants on Śiva or Durgā; (they are usually said to be eight). {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of Durgā.
